name: Right Levator Scapulae Stretch
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your back to a wall for support, if needed.
2. Place the palm of your right hand behind your lower back and gently pull it towards you until you feel a stretch on the right side of your upper back.
3. Hold onto the other arm across the left shoulder or at the side for assistance if desired to maintain balance throughout the stretch.
4. Continue holding and feeling the stretch across your muscles for about 30 seconds, focusing on the levator scapulae muscle's gentle release.
5. Slowly lower your hand back into place as the pressure around your spine reduces after you've released your hold.
short_summary: Right Levator Scapulae Stretch is a targeted upper body flexion stretch that helps in releasing tension and strain across certain muscles.
